intro: Epilobium stefanescui, commonly known as Stefanescu's willowherb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Romania and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
